Name: Adrar
Description: Adrar is a region in the north-central part of Mauritania, characterized by vast desert landscapes, including part of the Sahara.

Name: Assaba
Description: Assaba is located in the southern part of Mauritania, known for its agricultural activity and large pastoral communities.

Name: Brakna
Description: Brakna is in the southwestern part of Mauritania and is a major agricultural region, producing crops such as millet, maize, and sorghum.

Name: Gorgol
Description: Gorgol is located in the southern part of Mauritania and is known for its fertile lands and agriculture, especially rice cultivation.

Name: Guidimaka
Description: Guidimaka is in the southeastern part of Mauritania, known for its pastoralism and rural communities.

Name: Hodh El Gharbi
Description: Hodh El Gharbi is located in the eastern part of Mauritania and is mainly a desert region with small oases and a nomadic lifestyle.

Name: Hodh El Chargui
Description: Hodh El Chargui is in the southeastern region of Mauritania and is also a desert area, home to various nomadic tribes.

Name: Inchiri
Description: Inchiri is a region in the northwestern part of Mauritania, known for its arid conditions and desert landscapes.

Name: Tagant
Description: Tagant is located in central Mauritania, characterized by vast desert terrain, and is sparsely populated with nomadic tribes.

Name: Tiris Zemmour
Description: Tiris Zemmour is in the northern part of Mauritania, close to the border with Western Sahara, and is largely a desert region.

Name: Nouakchott
Description: Nouakchott is the capital and largest city of Mauritania, located on the Atlantic coast, serving as the country s economic, political, and cultural hub.
